values: MRI-ESM2.0
earth system model

MRI-ESM 2.0 is an earth system model that consists of an atmospheric general circulation model including a land surface model, which is coupled with an interactive aerosol model and an atmospheric chemistry model, and an ocean general circulation model including a sea ice model. The model can simulate the Earth's carbon cycle by expressing the terrestrial ecosystem,  ocean biogeochemical processes and carbon dioxide transport by the atmosphere.
No flux corrections are appled.
MRI-CGCM2.3.2
MRI-CGCM3 and MRI-ESM1

The atmosphere model, the ocean model, the aerosol model and the atmospheric chemistry model are updated. Updates of the atmosphere model includes increase of vertical layers from 48 to 80 and introduction of new parameterizations for non-orographic gravity wave drag and stratocumulus clouds. Updates of the ocean model includes increase in meridional resolution near the equator and many modifications of subgrid scale parameterizations such as introduction of the generic length scale scheme for vertical mixing.
MRI (internal)
FORTRAN90
Four independent component models are coupled via a coupler.
